text: for the first time the America's Cup is
being held close enough to shore to be a
spectator sport and there's definitely
something to see the new boats are
faster than ever
these boats called AC 72 SR 72 foot long
wing sailed catamarans as they pick up
speed the crafts lift out of the water
on top of small carbon-fiber Hydra foils
and accelerate to speeds as fast as 50
miles per hour
that's more than twice as fast as the
boats that competed at the last
America's Cup in Spain and it's almost
four times as fast as traditional mono
hauled yachts that have participated in
the race for over a century
when you have 1/4 of the time to make
the right decision that you had in years
past there's an incredible pressure on
the crew to get everything right because
consequences from making a mistake and
these boats can be catastrophic higher
speeds have been an increased level of
danger as well as another barrier to
entry designing and racing these boats
is really expensive the cost of an
America's Cup campaign has crept up to
as much as a hundred million dollars a
lot of potential participants who were
enthusiastic about it early on couldn't
find the funds to be competitive the few
teams who are participating are part of
the evolution of a 162 year old sailing
event that has now become an extreme
sport
